On 6/2/06, C=C3=A9dric Beust =E2=99=94 <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
> I hav=
e been fortunate to work with very talented QA engineers who were
> absolut=
ely brilliant at improving the tests initially supplied by the
> developers=
, and obviously, TDD is quite irrelevant for these QA
> departments
> since=
 the code has already been written.


Just a slight disagreement here - I w=
ould suggest that TDD is quite relevant
if the QA department is augmenting =
the automated unit tests.  In my
experience, it's much easier to add tests =
to code that has been designed for
testability.  Take one developer that us=
ed TDD to deliver a project, and one
that added tests afterwards and pass t=
he results to a talented QA engineer.
I would bet that the QA person is muc=
h more productive adding tests to the
first system.

Cheers!
Carl
